name: fibre production, viscose | sulfuric acid | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/9834/documentation

The inventory represents the production of viscose fibre using sulfate pulp as the main constituent. This transformation of sulphate pulp to spinnable viscose is done using carbon disulfide. In the process, sulphate pulp reacts with carbon disulfide and sodium hydroxide to create a solution that can be spun into a fibre.;;The dataset models all relevant inputs and steps necessary for the production of the fibre. Inputs are for example water, electricity, heat and chemical substances. Infrastracture is also considered. The process also recovers parts of the initially used materials, namely producing sodium sulfate and sulfuric acid.

Activity starts with the arrival of sulphate pulp and all the relevant necessary inputs such as water, chemicals, heat and electricity.

Activity ends with the production of finished viscose fibre at the production site.
category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/203:Manufacture of man-made fibres/2030:Manufacture of man-made fibres

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Data are from an Austrian company having production sites in different countries, so the data can be taken as an global average.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Transformation of sulfate pulp by CS2 to spinnable viscose
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Some data are derived from other technologies.
